alert.note: Alert for Northern Erie (New York) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued October 10 at 5:57PM EDT by NWS Buffalo
info.description: ...HEAVY LAKE EFFECT RAIN WILL AFFECT NORTHEASTERN ERIE COUNTY THROUGH 730 PM EDT... At 547 PM EDT, Doppler radar was tracking a band of heavy lake effect rain impacting portions of the Buffalo Metro, most persistent over Buffalo, Cheektowaga, Depew and West Seneca. Radar indicates some locations under this band may have already seen 0.50 to 1.00 inch of rain since mid afternoon. Expect this band of lake effect rain to remain nearly stationary through 730 PM resulting in flooding of poor drainage and low-lying areas. Locations impacted include... Buffalo, Cheektowaga, West Seneca, Clarence, Lackawanna, Depew, Lancaster, Williamsville, Small Boat Harbor, Erie Basin Marina, and Clarence Center. This includes Interstate 90 between exits 49 and 54. The heavy rain occurring with this band of lake effect rain may lead to localized flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways.
